results.title: The Brothers Byrne
results.creator_credit: William Gough, Rex Tasker, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Torn between the world of their childhood and the world where they must mow live and work, two flamboyant Newfoundlanders pay a nostalgic visit to the deserted outport where they were born. This is their story, and the story of so many others who, like them, became victims of the Newfoundland government’s controversial Resettlement Program. Credits include: Photography by Kent Nason.

results.title: The Brothers Bloom
results.brief_description: The Brothers Bloom are the best con men in the world, swindling millionaires with complex scenarios of lust and intrigue. Now they’ve decided to take on one last job – showing a beautiful and eccentric heiress the time of her life with a romantic adventure that takes them around the world.

constellations_other.name: Powerful women in the frame and behind the scenes
constellations_other.description: Lady Sarah (Rachel Weisz) exudes power in The Favourite. These female filmmakers and actors do too.

results.title: The Brotherhood of St Laurence
results.creator_credit: Brotherhood of St Lawrence Production Co
results.brief_description: The Brotherhood, which is based in Melbourne, works for a better deal for disadvantaged people. This documentary describes the Brotherhood’s beginnings; its current welfare services, including accommodation for older people, a material aid service, and a sheltered workshop; its support for other independent groups; and its involvement in social issues.

results.title: The Brother from Another Planet
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, Peggy Rajski and A-Train Films
results.brief_description: An alien spaceship, piloted by a runaway slave from a distant planet, crash lands in New York harbour. From it emerges a bedraggled, bewildered extra-terrestrial. Alone in New York, he is fair game for shysters, pushers and hookers - but worse is yet to come when two intergalactic bounty hunters beam down to recapture him. Writer/Director Sayles humorously mirrors modern society through the innocent eyes of this alien brother.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, Peggy Rajski and A-Train Films

results.title: The Brood
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Claude Heroux, Mutual Productions and Elgin International Films
results.brief_description: Director David Cronenberg considers this film his most personal one to date. A bold admission considering the disturbing material and particularly bitter look at marital break ups and the psychological effects that are passed down the generations. Cronenberg treats his themes of family dysfunction with his usual trade marks of experimental therapies run amuck and bodies rebelling against their hosts in the most visceral and graphic ways. Oliver Reed plays Doctor Hal Raglan, the mind behind an unconventional and radical institute which deals specifically with the physical effects of rage on the human body. One of his star pupils, the deranged Nola (Samantha Eggar), begins to use this very strange form of anger management to get back at her ex-husband (Art Hindle) who has custody of their five year old daughter. Cast also includes Cindy Hinds, Henry Beckman, Nuala Fitzgerald.

results.title: The Bronte sisters
results.creator_credit: Peter Hort, Skan Productions and Vermont Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous authors”.
Filmed in and around the village of Haworth in Yorkshire where the Bronte sisters spent most of their short lives, this program gives a biographical account of this most extraordinary literary family.

results.title: The Bronswick affair
results.creator_credit: Andre Leduc, Robert Awad, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A very funny yet deadly serious film, The Bronswick Affair, demonstrates the effectiveness of advertising in motivating people to buy products they don’t need. It entertains through the comic appeal of its characters and the baroque situations they fall prey to. It also lays bare some facts about the excesses of consumerism prompted by a steady flow of commercials. Nine awards including Chicago; New York; Yorkton; Columbus; Melbourne.

results.title: The Broken wings = Lal Aghnihat el moutakasra
results.creator_credit: Yousef Malouf, Touric Kairouz and Touric Kairouz-Antoine Khoury
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, ‘The Broken Wings’ is adapted from Khalil Gibran’s (The Prophet) autobiography and made on location in Lebanon, set at the turn of the century. Writer and painter Gibran is introduced to Salma, only daughter of Sheikh Fares, a wealthy and influential aristocrat. Salma is a woman of ethereal beauty, a pure and noble soul and she and Gibran fall instantly in love. Their courtship is chaste and lengthy, watched over by Salma’s aunt as chaperone. A local bishop waylays the couple after convincing Fares that Salma should marry his nephew, Mansour Bey, a man from a reputable family but who is openly pursuing a relationship with another woman and acutely aware of the money he is marrying into. A disheartened Salma enters the loveless marriage, Gibran’s love increasing by the day. Tragedy ensues when Fares passes away, leaving his son in law to squander the family’s money and his daughter without protection. Bey is intent on Salma producing an heir. Sentimental and melodramatic, the film has a lyrical quality and strong performances that resonates long after viewing. All prints of the film vanished from circulation for many years, due to civil strife in Lebanon. After the surprise discovery of prints in an abandoned church outside of Beirut, the film was restored and reissued. Cast includes: Pierre Borday (Kahlil Gibran), Saladin Nader (Mansour Bey), Nidal Ashkar (Salma), Philip Akiki (Sheik Fares). In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: The Broken silence
results.creator_credit: Peter Drummond, Phillip Morris and Beaumaris Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film describes the University of Papua New Guinea and its place in the transformation of the Territory into a modern nation, as seen by a student from the Eastern Highlands. He compares the urban life of Port Moresby with the traditional culture of villages like his, and the University’s special problems are discussed. Commentary by Benais Sabumei and Brian Muir.

results.title: The Broken covenant (A)
results.creator_credit: David M. Thompson, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Encounters”.
Many of Australia’s urban Aborigines live in appalling physical conditions and are seen by some Australians as derelicts. But to Father Ted Kennedy, a Catholic priest who works in the inner-city suburb of Redfern, they still retain an essential quality of life missing in white society.
